channel.title: Makefile on Dash's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Makefile on Dash's Blog

item.title: Makefile for Projects with Subdirectories
item.description: Abstract In order to manage our project easily, we may tend to make for help. Usually, our projects will contians many subdirectories. So writing a makefile which can always compile our projects successfully when our project add, delete or modify some sub-dirs is quite important. Background Take my private projects kmusb for example. It file structure is like: . ├── README.md ├── arg_parser │ ├── arg_parser.c │ └── arg_parser.h ├── bin ├── data ├── kmusb.
